SENT.plain: The prevalence and natural history of asymptomatic intracranial arterial stenosis are not very well characterized
Existing data suggest that incidentally discovered asymptomatic intracranial stenosis presents a fairly low risk of stroke, though substantial uncertainty remains
Patients may be at greater risk if there are tandem stenoses
Methods to stratify the risk of stroke with asymptomatic intracranial atherosclerotic lesions have yet to be established and validated
In general, aggressive intervention for an asymptomatic intracranial stenosis is not currently recommended
